title: Brook’s blazing 100 fires England into T20 World Cup Semis
byline: Captain Harry Brook smashed a sensational maiden T20I century to steer the England cricket team into the T20 World Cup semi-finals with a thrilling two-wicket win over the Pakistan national cricket team in Pallekele.

title: Spiritual godfather of cricketers passes away
byline: Charismatic clergyman, Rev Fr. Stephan Abraham who was the rector of St. Anthony’s College at Katugastota, a school that produced many a cricketer, passed away last Saturday.

title: Aghanistan appoint new head coach after Trott’s departure
byline: The Afghanistan Cricket Board have named Richard Pybus as Jonathan Trott’s successor.

title: Exports rebound sharply in January
byline: The local export sector kicked off 2026 on a firmer footing with January earnings rising 13.7 percent year-on-year (YoY) to US$ 1.53 billion, offering an early boost to foreign exchange inflows and growth expectations.

title: Tuk-tuk rental company asks for its rights
byline: Referring to the recent decision by the Court of Appeal to issue an interim order preventing the police from taking action against foreign tourists who ride three-wheelers, (from tuktukrental.com), a company which rents three wheelers to foreign tourists who hold international driving licenses, yesterday said police media spokesperson is engaged in issuing contradictory statements,

title: Extraditing Arjuna Mahendran not a simple procedure: Nalinda
byline: Claiming that the government is making a diplomatic intervention to extradite former Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran from Singapore, Cabinet Spokesman Dr Nalinda Jayatissa said yesterday that extraditing Mahendran is not a simple procedure.

title: Unusual sex clinic disguised as homeopathy centre raided in Ambatale
byline: A sex centre operating under the guise of a homeopathic treatment clinic in the Ambatale area of the Mulleriyawa Police Division was raided by officers of the Western Province (South) Crime Division.

title: Former SIS Chief Suresh Sallay arrested
byline: Former  State Intelligence Services (SIS) Chief Major General (Retired) Suresh Sallay has been arrested in connection with ongoing investigations into the 2019 Easter Sunday terror attacks, Police Spokesman ASP F.U Wootler said.

title: Govt. has not taken any decision to stop construction of Jaffna stadium: Nalinda
byline: The government has not taken any decision to stop the construction of the proposed international cricket stadium in Jaffna, and that construction work will go ahead as planned, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Dr Nalinda Jayatissa said yesterday.

title: Environmental groups vow not to allow project to proceed at same location
byline: Concerns were raised after it was revealed that construction work on the proposed Jaffna International Cricket Stadium had commenced without obtaining mandatory environmental clearance.

title: Japan to deploy missiles on island near Taiwan by 2031
byline: Japan plans to deploy surface-to-air missiles to its remote western island near Taiwan by March 2031, its defence minister said, as regional tensions simmer.

title: Sri Lankan probed at Italy cricket scandal
byline: I talian cricket is in crisis days after the country’s T20 World Cup debut, as it emerged that a senior national governing body official has been investigated over a sexual assault allegation.

title: Sri Lanka, Portugal to form committee on return of artefacts
byline: Sri Lanka’s Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath and Portugal’s Foreign Minister Paulo Rangel agreed to establish a joint committee to conduct a preliminary study on the return of Sri Lankan artefacts currently held in Portugal.

title: Opposition politicians meet Ranil on forming joint force
byline: Representatives of opposition political parties met former President Ranil Wickremesinghe today at his office to discuss  joint mechanisms under which all opposition parties could work together.

title: Sri Lanka aims to increase digital foreign earnings to $5 billion by 2030
byline: Sri Lanka currently earns 1.6 billion US dollars in foreign exchange from the digital industry, and plans are underway to increase that amount to 5 billion dollars by 2030, Deputy Minister of Digital Economy Eranga Weeraratne said.

title: Hypocrisy of the Tamil Diaspora
byline: Every time a Sri Lankan leader lands in a Western capital, a predictable yet hypocritical drama unfolds. A small but vocal segment of the Tamil diaspora gathers outside, waving the flag of the LTTE and chanting slogans about justice and human rights. They accuse. They condemn. They disrupt.

title: Inland Revenue launches taxpayer privilege card scheme
byline: The Department of Inland Revenue has introduced a new Taxpayer Privilege Card Scheme to recognize and reward individual taxpayers who consistently meet their tax obligations. The initiative is designed to encourage voluntary self-assessment payments, reduce tax evasion, and honor citizens who make significant contributions to the national revenue.

title: Sri Lanka seeks to broaden workforce collaboration with South Korea
byline: Discussing ways to advance Sri Lanka’s engagement under the Employment Permit System (EPS) and broaden collaboration beyond existing frameworks, Foreign Affairs and Overseas Employment Deputy Minister Arun Hemachandra, met with officials of the Korean Human Resources Development Institute (HRDK) in Seoul yesterday (24).

title: Three former Trade Ministry officials arrested on corruption charges
byline: Three former senior officials of the Ministry of Trade have been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) over alleged corruption linked to a procurement process.

title: UK to enforce travel permit requirement from Feb 25 on foreign visitors
byline: Starting on Feb 25, visitors to Britain from 85 countries must obtain an electronic permit in advance of their trip or they will be barred from travelling, the British Interior Ministry said.

title: Liquor income surges on Aswesuma payment day
byline: Liquor shop owners across several areas in the upcountry report a significant increase in sales on Aswesuma payment day compared to previous days.

title: Police arrest second suspect in Akuregoda lawyer and wife shooting
byline: Police have arrested the second suspect allegedly involved in the shooting death of a lawyer and his wife in Akuregoda, Thalangama, the Police Media Division said yesterday (24).

title: Air Force hands over modern IT facility to rural school
byline: In line with its forthcoming 75th Anniversary, the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) ceremonially handed over a fully equipped Information Technology (IT) laboratory to BT/BT/Koddaimunai Kanishta Vidyalaya in Batticaloa.

title: Ali Sabry raises concerns over arrest of Suresh Sallay
byline: Former Minister Ali Sabry has expressed concern over the arrest of former State Intelligence Chief Suresh Sallay, describing it as a troubling development for the Sri Lanka Army and its Intelligence Corps.

title: Court frees Daisy Forrest in money laundering case
byline: The Colombo High Court today ordered that Daisy Forrest, the grandmother of Yoshitha Rajapaksa, be released from the case filed against her under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

title: Wildlife Department to probe misuse of national park tourist bungalows
byline: The Wildlife Conservation Department has announced that it will conduct a formal investigation following reports that tourist bungalows in some national parks are being booked online and used for purposes other than wildlife viewing.

title: Land ownership granted to long-term residents in Anamaduwa
byline: A special program to grant legal land ownership to families who have lived for many years without proper rights was held yesterday (24) at the Anamaduwa Divisional Secretariat. The event was presided over by State Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government Minister Prof. Chandana Abayarathna.

title: Suresh Sallay to be detained for 72 hours
byline: Former State Intelligence Services (SIS) Chief, Major General (Retired) Suresh Sallay who was arrested under the Prevention of Terrorism (Temporary Provisions) Act, is to be detained for 72 hours for questioning, police said.

title: The loneliest train in the world?
byline: A train halted near the Ulapane–Warakapitiya Railway Station has remained stranded for four months after a landslide triggered by heavy rains associated with the Ditwah cyclone caused severe damage to the railway line, railway department sources said.

title: CEB engineers to stage six-hour token strike tomorrow
byline: The CEB Technical Engineers and Superintendents Association has scheduled a six-hour token strike tomorrow (26), citing the government’s failure to respond to eight trade union demands.

title: Police seek public assistance to locate murder suspect
byline: Police seek public assistance to locate the suspect who is wanted for the murder of an individual inside a shop at the Wadiyamankada junction area in Kalutara North on February 14, 2026.

title: Court of Appeal dismisses Avant-Garde writ petitions over Navy armories
byline: The Court of Appeal today dismissed two writ petitions filed by Avant Garde Maritime Security Pvt. Ltd. (AGMS) challenging the decision to hand over certain armouries, belonging to the Sri Lanka Navy, back to the Navy.

title: Vijitha Herath to visit Germany, Romania
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism, Vijitha Herath will undertake an official visit to Germany and Romania, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism said.

title: Indian High Commissioner meets Ranil
byline: Indian High Commissioner in Sri Lanka Santhosh Jha met former President Ranil Wickremesinghe at the latter’s office at Flower Road, Colombo today.

title: CBSL warns public on prohibited pyramid schemes
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has issued a public notice warning against a number of companies and mobile applications found to have engaged in prohibited pyramid schemes in violation of Section 83C of the Banking Act, No. 30 of 1988, as amended.

title: Sri Lanka to host 60th anniversary of World Buddhist Sangha Council
byline: The commemorative celebration marking the 60th anniversary of the World Buddhist Sangha Council (WBSC), together with the 2nd Executive Committee meeting of the 11th General Assembly, is scheduled to be held in Sri Lanka from 28 November to 2 December, President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Phone hacking scandal: suspect demands nude videos
byline: A young man, accused of intimidating young women by demanding nude videos for the past three years, was ordered to be remanded till March 6 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama today.
